Key Match Events: The Yankees gave away free outs and bases in the fifth inning of Game 5 of the World Series against the Dodgers.
Tommy Kahnle and Luke Weaver were haunted by free bases in the 7-6, series-clinching loss.
A walk to No. 8 hitter Will Smith to load the bases and a freak catcher’s interference handed Shohei Ohtani a free jog to first base.
Gavin Lux tied the game with a two-strike fastball to deep left-center.
Mookie Betts put the Dodgers on top for good with a first-pitch fastball.
Shohei Ohtani reached first base on catcher’s interference, the first in a Fall Classic since Game 3 of the 1982 World Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Tommy Kahnle expressed that the loss will sting for a long time and that there was more they could have done.
Luke Weaver reflected on the challenge of facing three of the best hitters in the world and the importance of executing fundamental baseball.
Mookie Betts shared his approach at the plate, emphasizing putting the ball in play and trusting his gut.
Tommy Kahnle mentioned that the team will look back on the plays they can clean up and move on.
